result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob C Boudreau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 10:40am. 
Defendant Jacob C Boudreau in court, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.  ADA Beck confirms that Mr. Boudreau has paid the restitution amount in full.
Attorney Zarwell submits three letters in support of Mr. Boudreau. 
Mr. Boudreau makes a statement.  


On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Boudreau to 3 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year &  6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.
The Court finds that Mr. Boudreau is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp" or for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 118 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders that the previously ordered as conditions of Probation are now conditions of Extended Supervision [the applicable conditions are: 
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of any illegal drug
--No possession of drug paraphernalia
--To undergo anger mangement, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No acts/threats of violence towards any persons
--Maintain stable residence
--Maintain employment or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--May use electronic monitoring if deemed appropriate
--No contact with Dustin Nelson or Mr. Nelson's immediate family
--Random urinalyses
--To comply with COMPASS evaluation if not already completed
--To pay any balance due on court-ordered financial obligations] 

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given

Case called at 3:59 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jacob C Boudreau in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 to Substantial Battery, as a Repeater, contrary to 940.19(2) 939.62(1)(b), a Class I felony

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count#2
Parties jointly request PSI; Court orders PSI (long form) with report due to the Court no later than 11/12/14
Court reminds Mr. Boudreau that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while the case is pending

NEXT: Schedule Sentencing Hearing 12/4/2014 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Case called at 11:15 am [Clerk SH] (Final Status Scheduling Conference)
Defendant Jacob C Boudreau in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek confirms that she is ready to proceed to trial on Monday

1 alternate
5 strikes
Jurors may take notes and ask questions
Jury to be ready by 8:45 am 
Court reviews with Mr. Boudreau his right to/not to testify.

On Defense Motion to Impeach:
Arguments by Counsel
Court grants defense motion subject to cite submission re: OWI by State
Court finds that Mr. Kessler has 1 prior conviction for impeachment purposes
Court finds that Mr. Ready has 3 prior convictions for impeachment purposes
Court finds that Mr. Nelson has 1 prior convictions for impeachment purposes

Atty Svehlek orally motions for witness exclusion; Court grants with exception of Court Officer & directs parties - from opening statements until evidence is closed
Court charges Counsel to convey order to all potential witnesses

On State's motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions:
Arguments by Counsel
Court grants State's Motion
Court finds that Mr. Boudreau has 4 prior convictions for impeachment purposes

No Miranda Goodchild Issues
Court grants Notice to Admit Statements Made by Def. subject to standard objections

ADA Shock: State has 7 witnesses (1 officer/6 citizens); all have been subpoenaed
Atty Svehlek: 3 witnesses; do have witnesses subpoeaned for Tuesday
Upon questioning of the Court; ADA Shock indicates that they should be able to fill day 1 of trial
Atty Svehlek raises concerns re: expert witness testimony - no objection to medical records
Court informs parties that It does not wish for expert to go into causation issues 
Court reviews with Mr. Boudreau that today by 3:00 pm is the last date he may enter change of plea in this matter
off-record: 11:35 - 11:36 am for Mr. Boudreau to speak with counsel
ADA Shock raises concerns regarding submission of defense witness list today; may ask for witness exclusion 
Court informs parties that It will allow State to raise objections re: witnesses the morning of trial 
Court reminds Mr. Boudreau that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 11:37 am 

NEXT: Jury trial to proceed as scheduled - Monday 9/15/14 at 8:30 am
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Impeach Witnesses with Prior Convictions
Scheduling Notice
Final status/scheduling conference on September 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 10:40 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jacob C Boudreau in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek: Requests adjournment of trial, presents basis including 3 items that need further investigating & one new witness provided last week. Now finally have contact information for this witness. 
Court reviews case file documents & previous STAO for adjournment submitted back in July
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Svehlek indicates that she has been diligent in efforts
ADA Teuber: Is 2nd time matter has been set for trial; State's witnesses are 6 citizens and 1 officer - all witnesses have been served & are available, presents concerns about future service on all citizen witnesses. Alleged victim is represented by legal counsel, Atty Rumpf is present in gallery.
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Rumpf indicates that he does represent alleged victim & client takes no position of calendering of matter as long as notice is given. Will be submitting further restitution request to DAs office. Client has authorized acting in this matter in limited capacity.
Court/Counsel have colloquy re: adjournment request
Court informs parties that It will recall matter in 2 days and charges parties to have update on all matters at that time, will make decision about trial adjournment at that time. Court charges ADA Teuber to attempt tp contact 2 witnesses regarding availability on alternate trial dates in November/December.
Court reminds Mr. Boudreau that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 11:09 am 

NEXT: (1) Notices given in Court - Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jake C Boudreau

Case called at 9:01 am [Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing]
Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews information received from Sheriff's Dept. that transport would be late as Mr. Boudreau was not in Dane County, but Sturtevant. Court is planning to call case once Mr. Boudreau arrives, which will be around 10:00 am.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that she will have scheduling conflict as she has a juvenile matter in another court that will take at least 45 minutes. Could possibly be available by 10:30 am. Requests matter be reset, presents further basis including a review of the conversation between State and Atty Rumpf (who represents the alleged victim) in the gallery while the Court was on the bench regarding amended charges being filed. Requests that this Court not hear preliminary hearing when it is set, would like set before another Reserve Judge or Judge Koschnick.
Court informs parties that It did not overhear any conversation between counsel, but will recuse from hearing any future hearings in the matter.
Court reschedules Preliminary Hearing - Atty Svehlek waives time limits
Court directs Deputy present to contact the transport to have them return to Sturtevant & for State to prepare writ
Recess: 9:07 am 

NEXT: **FUTURE HEARINGS NOT TO BE SET WITH JUDGE KLOSSNER** Rescheduled Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am- Send notices **Def. in Sturtevant**

Case called at 2:17 pm
Defendant Jake C Boudreau in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted 
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Charges and maximum penalties recited; reading waived
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Court and DA Happ discuss scriveners error on page two, Court amends by it's own hand to amend scriveners error to knuckles, and scriverner's error to He.
Court reviews the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Dustin Nelson, Kare Nelson, Jeremy Nelson, James Kessler, Nicholas Reddy, Sue Nelson, Brandon Walsh, Kyle LeBarge or Nathan Johnson
-Defendant must appear at the Preliminary Hearing on 3/28/14 at 8:30 am

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit.(requested by the defense)

Recess: 2:25 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 3/28/14 at 8:30 am
